review: I like it. It had me a bit frustrated for a half hour trying to get it to accept the network password and moving around the onscreen keypad. I finally unplugged the power cable for a few seconds, plugged it back in and it connected right away. I went to the website support to learn that the upper ring on the remote is a navigation button most useful for typing on the keypad. Boy did I feel stupid. That's all behind me now and I was really glad to see that, like the Kindle fire HD, it's possible to sideload other apps. So now the Fire TV Stick can access all the drives on the network where I keep all the good stuff. My TV is built in so another thing I was glad of is the remote does not have to be line of site, it does work very well through the wall. The one thing I would like for it to do is disconnect from the network without having to "forget" it, thus having to retype the password with my new friend, the remote ring. Maybe it's just me but I really don't like leaving all these electronic devices plotting against me when I'm not there to supervise. If you have a Prime account the Fire TV Stick is a nice stand alone device to use, just plug it in and leave it there. If you don't have a Prime account, get the stick anyway and go get some apps to load onto it.
